response:
Investigations should confirm optic nerve involvement, look for demyelinating lesions suggestive of multiple sclerosis, exclude compressive, infectious, and systemic autoimmune causes, and provide a baseline before initiating steroids or longer-term immunotherapy.

investigations = ["MRI of brain, orbits and cervical spinal cord with gadolinium", "Automated visual field testing (e.g., Humphrey perimetry)", "Optical coherence tomography of retinal nerve fiber layer and macula", "Visual evoked potentials", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein and glucose", "CSF oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "Serum aquaporin-4 (AQP4-IgG) antibody", "Serum myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein (MOG-IgG) antibody", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Blood glucose", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "C-reactive protein", "Antinuclear antibody (ANA)", "Extractable nuclear antigen (ENA) panel", "Double-stranded DNA antibody", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies (ANCA)", "Rheumatoid factor", "Serum complement C3 and C4", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) level", "Serum calcium", "Serum vitamin D level", "Syphilis serology (treponemal and non-treponemal tests)", "HIV antigen/antibody test", "Lyme disease serology", "Tuberculosis interferon-gamma release assay (e.g., Quantiferon-TB Gold)", "High-resolution CT chest", "ECG", "Hepatitis B and hepatitis C serology"]
